subject: Psychology
title: The Proximity Effect
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Proximity Effect.

hook.text: Your best friend in college lived next door. Your partner worked on the same floor. Proximity is destiny.

buildup.text: The proximity effect says we're most likely to form relationships with people who are physically close.

discovery.text: Festinger studied MIT dorms and found friendships formed almost entirely based on door-to-door distance.

twist.text: It's not just distance. Functional distance matters â€” people whose paths naturally cross bond the most.

climax.text: We think we choose our friends freely. Geography narrows the menu before we even start choosing.

punchline.text: Love and friendship often start with a short hallway.

quiz.question: What is the proximity effect in relationships?
options: We form bonds with people who are physically close
People prefer friends from far away
